a: A computer is an electronic device that can do work for people.
Software is a set of instructions that tell a computer what to do.
Hardware is the physical parts of a computer, like the screen and keyboard.
The internet is a big network where computers can talk to each other.
A mouse is a small tool you move to point at things on your screen.
A keyboard is a board with buttons that type letters and numbers into a computer.
An operating system runs the basic functions of a computer.
RAM is memory in a computer that stores data while it works.
A processor is the brain of a computer that does all the thinking.
A hard drive saves files when the computer is turned off.
Wi-Fi lets computers connect to the internet without wires.
A firewall protects a computer from bad stuff coming through the internet.
Antivirus software stops bad programs from harming your computer.
A browser shows websites so you can see web pages online.
A virus is a tiny program that can make your computer sick.
A laptop is a portable computer that you can carry around.
A desktop computer stays in one place and has a monitor, keyboard, and mouse.
A server is a powerful computer that keeps important information safe.
Cloud computing means using services from servers far away over the internet.
A printer makes copies of documents on paper.
A scanner turns pictures into digital images that can go on computers.
A motherboard connects all the parts of a computer together.

q: What is a USB flash drive?
a: A USB flash drive is a small drive that plugs into a computer to save files.
Bluetooth lets devices talk to each other without wires.
A smartphone is a phone that can also use apps and do many computer-like tasks.
A tablet is a flat computer you can touch to control it.
Artificial intelligence is when machines do smart things like humans do.
Machine learning is teaching computers to learn from examples like people do.
Cybersecurity is protecting computers and their users from bad stuff happening online.
Coding is writing instructions for computers to follow.
An algorithm is a set of rules for solving problems.
Data is information stored in a computer.
A computer virus is a program that makes copies of itself and spreads.
The motherboard connects all parts of a computer together.
A monitor is a screen where you see what the computer shows.
A router directs data packets between networks and the internet.
Virtual reality creates simulated environments you can experience through special devices.
Augmented reality mixes real-world views with digital information.
A webcam takes video pictures of people.
A graphics card makes pictures look better.
Solid-state drives make computers start up faster.
Big data is lots of information collected together.
Blockchain is a special way to keep records safe online.
Internet is where all computers talk to each other.
SSD is a fast storage device for computers.
USB is a small connector for plugging in devices.
In computing, a bug is a mistake in software that causes it to not work right.
Hack is when someone finds ways to make unauthorized changes to a computer system.
A software update fixes problems and adds new features to make a program better.
A USB drive is a small device that can store and transfer files.
Overclocking makes a computer faster by making its parts go faster.
Defragmentation organizes files on a hard drive to make them load faster.

q: What is a firewall in networking?
a: In networking, a firewall controls which data can enter or leave a network.

q: What is a virtual reality headset?
a: A VR headset lets you see a computer-generated world as if you're inside it.
A modem changes computer signals so they can travel through phone lines.
A pixel is the tiny dot that makes up an image on a screen.
An app is a program you use on phones or tablets.
Encryption keeps information safe by changing it into code.
Cloud means using something on the internet instead of on your own computer.
AI is when computers act smart and learn things like humans do.
A touchscreen lets you use your finger to control a device.
A robot is a machine that can do jobs usually done by people.
A network is when two or more computers are connected so they can share information.
A backup is a copy of important files kept safely just in case something goes wrong.
Firewall software keeps bad stuff out of your computer.
Malware is any bad software that can damage your computer.
A USB port lets you plug in devices like flash drives.
SSD stands for Solid State Drive and is faster than traditional hard drives.
A joystick is a control device that moves in different directions to move characters or vehicles in games.
A gamepad is a controller made for playing video games with buttons, joysticks, and other controls.
A computer chip is a very tiny circuit board inside a computer that controls everything else.
An interface is how people interact with a computer or app, like buttons and screens.
An application is a program we use for specific tasks.
A website is a collection of pages connected together online.
USB means Universal Serial Bus; it's a connector for plugging in devices.
5G is the latest mobile network that lets phones get faster internet.
A sound card makes sounds come out of speakers when playing games or music.
A game controller is used to play video games on computers.
A computer crash happens when something goes wrong and the computer stops working properly.
A database is a collection of information organized for easy access.
Internet is a network connecting many computers together worldwide.
Email is a way to send messages to people using computers.
Software development is making new programs and apps.
A software update makes your computer's programs better.
A firewall rule tells the firewall which kinds of traffic to allow or block.

q: What is a solid state drive?
a: A solid state drive uses chips instead of spinning disks to store data very fast.

q: What is a bug in computing?
a: A bug is when something doesn't work right in a program.
A computer network connects many computers together.
Social media is where people share thoughts and pictures online.
CPU means Central Processing Unit and it's the brain of the computer.
VR means Virtual Reality and it creates fake worlds.
AR means Augmented Reality and it adds digital stuff to real world.
GPU means Graphics Processing Unit and it draws images and videos.

q: What is a bug in coding?

A laptop battery powers a computer when it is turned off its charger.
A desktop is a personal computer designed to sit on a desk.
An app store is a place where you can find and download applications for mobile devices.
Antivirus is software that fights viruses.
A byte is a unit of measurement for data, like how many books are in a library.
A megabyte is a bigger unit of measurement for data, like having thousands of books.
A gigabyte is even bigger, like having millions of books.
A kilobyte is smaller than a megabyte, like having hundreds of books.
HTML is a language to write web pages that browsers can display.
CSS tells web pages how they should look, like colors and sizes.
JavaScript adds interactive elements to websites, making them more dynamic.
Microchips are tiny circuits built onto a small piece of silicon.
Programming is making computers do tasks by giving them rules.
A computer game is a fun activity played on a computer.
A game console is a special computer just for games.
A screen shows images and videos from a computer.
A crash is when the computer stops working suddenly.
A patch fixes problems in software.
An internet browser is a program to see web pages.
A worm is a type of computer virus that copies itself and spreads to other computers.
A trojan is a hidden program that looks safe but actually harms your computer.
Phishing is when someone tricks you into giving them your personal info by pretending to be trustworthy.
Ransomware locks down your files until you pay money to get them back.
Storage keeps data safe on a computer.
A Trojan horse is a hidden program that looks good but harms the computer.
A botnet is a group of computers controlled by a bad person.
A digital signature proves who sent an electronic document.
A motherboard connects all the parts inside a computer.

A computer case holds all the parts of a computer together.
